column4: Can anyone help with installing Ubuntu from one partition to another on the same HDD?
how
ive never used the dd
what do you mean you've placed the LiveCD in one?
I extracted the LiveCD contents as well as SuperGrub to one partition via Unetbootin
and it boots
So you installed it?
Burn to a CD then.
i dont have an external CD drive
You can order one for like $5.
What kind of computer do you have?
toshiba m200 portege, a real beast to reinstall
this model only boots for very particular and expensive cdroms
you have a picky cd drive? Thats a new one. xD
Were you able to get ubuntu running as a live image?
when placed on (hd0,2) yes it runs just fine
Do you not want to install there?
but when installing onto (hd0,0), it seems to think (hd0,2) is /cdrom, thus interfering with assigning the mounting point /
:S I'm not really an expert on this. I'd suggest coming back during the day. Thats where I've found there are more people to help.
summary: liveCD on partition A, want to actually install full OS on partition B, refuses to do so
system, pref, appearance
